## GAD-7 vs BPFSC

Psychologists and other mental health professionals often need to correlate different questionnaires for more accurate and comprehensive patient assessments. Two such questionnaires are the Generalised Anxiety Disorder 7-item (GAD-7) and the Borderline Personality Disorder Features Scale (24-item) or BPFSC. The comparison or harmonisation of these two tools, GAD-7 vs BPFSC, can be extremely time-consuming. However, innovative software like Harmony has turned this challenging task into a simpler and quicker process. Harmony utilises natural language processing and generative AI models to assist researchers in harmonising questionnaire items effortlessly. With GAD-7 vs BPFSC, Harmony's large language models compare instruments and provide a percentage match between each item in both these scales. Moreover, Harmony's advanced features allow for items comparison in multiple languages, which exponentially broadens the scope of research and diagnosis. Inviting all psychologists to leverage the power of AI in their practice with Harmony! For GAD-7 vs BPFSC matching, simply select the instruments from Harmony's database or drag and drop your own instruments in PDF format into Harmony's web interface. Expediting the harmonisation process is not just more efficient but also aids in precision and comprehensiveness of psychological evaluations.

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and BPFSC

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and BPFSC into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just BPFSC into Harmony</a> - compare BPFSC with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
